page.title: 08THE HUDNALLS WOOD
page.content: The Hudnalls is an area of common land stretching from Coldharbour to Brockweir.No-one actually lives in the woods but there are many dwellings nearby.Mr.George Creswick is the Keeper of the Hudnalls.He is 88 and his family have lived on the Common since 1497.He has to make sure that the woods are kept in good order. St.Briavels residents are allowed to take animals to graze in the woods and to gather wood.In earlier times the people used the wood for their ovens and fires.Today,people are turning to wood as a source of fuel again. Goats are not allowed grazing because they eat the treebark. Every Whitsunday for more than 170 years the Creswick family have thrown bread and cheese to the parishioners after the evening service in recognit- ion of the use of the Hudnalls.
